adviseScripts.text: Birdie!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: What do you think is the most important when it comes to being a hero?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Your mind, and your physical strength.
Your popularity.
I see you already understand what it takes to be a hero!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Well done, Birdie.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: No, no, no!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: A hero can't let themselves get caught up in trivial things like popularity.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Besides, becoming a public sensation comes naturally when you vanquish enough villains.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I listen to Laplace go into excruciating detail about what's important to becoming a hero.
I've been waiting for what seems like ages, and there's still no sign of Laplace.
Should I go back?
*Creak*
Tah-dah! Here I am!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: ... Sit down.
You're late.
Sorry, I'm late.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Hahaha! Sorry I'm late, Birdie!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I was out fighting crime. A hero's work is never done!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Well, try and be on time in the future, hero.
You got it!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I tell Laplace about other heroes who are more punctual.
If you're walking down the street,
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: and you hear someone yell, "Help me! I need a hero!"
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: What would you do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Since I'm not a hero, I'd continue along my merry way.
I'd call you immediately.
You'd ignore someone in distress?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: You can't do that!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: If you do that, you're straying from the righteous path.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Brilliant, Birdie!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: If you're not a hero yourself,
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: then call in someone who is.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That's almost certainly the best course of action.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace and I pontificate about different ways to send a distress signal during an emergency.
Did you get in trouble with Maxwell?
Have you not eaten?
I refused to be lectured by Maxwell!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Just some friendly advice...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: All right... I'll listen to some advice...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Is it getting hot in here, or is it just me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: How did you know?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I forgot to eat breakfast this morning.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: A hero should know better than this. I need to take care of myself.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Time for some grub.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I spend some time having a discussion with Laplace.
Drake is really gung-ho about wanting to be a villain lately.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Why do you think that is? We're heroes after all...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: She doesn't want to be an ordinary hero.
Being a villain is more interesting than being a hero.
Okay.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I think I get it now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Thanks for clearing that up!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: What?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: No way! That doesn't make any sense!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: There must be another reason.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I talk a little more about Drake with Laplace.
Is there anything you think...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: a hero can't overcome?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: The Central Government?
Nothing whatsoever.
You think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Hmm...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Wait a sec!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: The Central Government isn't evil, so it's okay if we can't defeat them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Bingo!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: There's nothing that a hero can't overcome.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That's why I need to spread the hero's gospel, right now!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I calm Laplace down. She's chomping at the bit to run outside.
I just don't know what to do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Maxwell says I should pipe down and try and be a hero without yelling.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: But if I don't yell, I can't unleash my full power...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Use more body language and do all your yelling internally.
Don't let Maxwell browbeat you. Just keep shouting.
That's a solid idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: The real power comes from the heart anyway.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Body language... I'm not exactly well-versed in that,
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: but I'll give it a try. Thanks for the advice!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I don't think so.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I tried that a couple of times, and she said she wouldn't make me any more weapons.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I've got to figure something else out.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace and I practice ways for her to unleash her heroic powers without making too much noise.
If you could make one wish and have it come true,
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: what would it be?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: To be rich.
World peace.
So materialistic!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: You're officially disqualified as a hero.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: ... Incredible.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: A truly heroic wish if there ever was one.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: You've come a long way, Birdie. You're a bona fide hero!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace and I keep thinking about ways that we could make our wishes come true.
Let me tell you something.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: The surface will be reclaimed one day, and we'll be the ones who do it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That's what Nikkes were made to do, and it's what heroes were meant to do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I'm with you all the way.
Don't overdo it.
As long as we've got you in our corner,
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: that's the best encouragement we could ever hope for.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I'm not overdoing it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I just said I would do what I'm meant to do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Have a little more faith in me, Birdie.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I speak with Laplace about reclaiming the surface.
Hero power, charging...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Go.
Hmm...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That's the right word, but it needs more punch.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: You can't unleash your full heroic power unless it's got some oomph to it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Put some effort into it!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Nicely done!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: It's got a real punch to it. That'll unleash your heroic power for sure.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I'll shout like that each time I use my powers!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Together with Laplace, I experiment with different sounds.
Let's say there's a researcher trapped inside a burning power plant,
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: and there's a giant water tank adjacent to the building.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: What would you do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I'd get a drink of water to calm my nerves.
I'd soak myself in the water and charge into the blazing inferno like a hero should.
Well said.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Buildings are unpredictable when they're on fire, particularly a power plant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Your best option is to keep calm and wait until the proper authorities arrive.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I'm afraid you're wrong, Birdie.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: You can't just go charging into any old building unless you're the right person for the job.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Which, of course, would be me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace teaches me how to drink water without choking.
Tell me, what do you think is a shortcoming of mine?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Don't hold back. I won't get offended.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: You're a bit... stentorian.
The fact that you have no shortcomings is your shortcoming.
That's because I'm filled to the brim with power.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That's hardly what I'd call a shortcoming.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: It's just a matter of preference.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Interesting...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: The fact I don't have any shortcomings almost makes me a supernatural force.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: ... Oh well! Nothing I can do about that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I suggest ways Laplace can overcome her shortcomings while trying not to hurt her feelings.
Once in a blue moon,
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I think about those I couldn't save.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I can't help feeling regretful... What if I had more power then?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: What difference would that make?
All you can do is keep moving forward.
... You're right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Feeling sorry for myself won't change anything.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I won't make that mistake again.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: But nothing changes.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I can't shake this feeling of regret.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I spend time talking about the past with Laplace.
I can't take any more of Maxwell's nagging!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I used water to wash a battery, and she chewed me out
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: for an entire hour.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That's a bit overkill.
Well, you did screw up.
Right?! It's too much!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Sure, there was an iiiitty-bitty explosion, but it's not like anyone got hurt.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Only one room was destroyed.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: ... Okay, Maxwell may be in the right.
I realize that!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: But a whole hour?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: It's too much... Too much...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I teach Laplace ways to let nagging wash over her like water off a duck's back.
A while ago, a package was delivered in front of our building.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: When I opened it, there was a knife, and a small note with the word "Kill!" on it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: What do you think that's all about?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: It means someone is accusing you of being a killer.
I think it may be a threat.
Well, they're not wrong. I do kill.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Killing it as a hero, that is!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: But why? Was it something I did?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: No way. I haven't done anything wrong.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Besides, threats don't scare me. I'm a hero! I'm invincible!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace teaches me how to properly gift-wrap a box.
Do you prefer beam-based weapons or ones that use live ammunition?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Personally, I'm partial to beam-based weapons.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: You can't beat live ammunition.
No contest. A beam weapon comes out on top.
Wha... how could you!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I'm disappointed in you, Birdie.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Everyone knows beam weapons are where it's at.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I knew you'd agree with me!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: There are plenty of reasons why they're the best, but the biggest of all
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: is that they're like a beam of light that repels evil.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace and I go over the latest trends and tropes in mecha anime.
I'm sure you're already aware of this, but I transform when I go into battle mode.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: It's only for a moment, but I'm totally defenseless during this transformation.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: If you were my enemy, what would you do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I'd take advantage of the chink in your armor.
I'd want a fair fight. I'd wait until you had fully transformed before fighting.
But that's so cowardly!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I understand you don't want to let such a great opportunity pass you by,
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: but... er...
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: you still shouldn't do it!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I knew you wouldn't stoop so low as to attack a defenseless opponent.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That's just the kind of person you are.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace and I watch videos of different heroes transforming.
Today's topic is: can villains be forgiven?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Birdie! Tell me what you think!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Yes, they can.
No, they can't.
I can't say that I agree with you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Even if a villain changes their ways, they can never take back all the evil deeds they've committed.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: To me, that means they can never be forgiven.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: So, we're on the same page.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Broken glass can never be put back together again. Even if they repent, they can't undo the damage they've done.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Evil acts have repercussions which last forever. They can never be erased.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Laplace looking at the encyclopedia of villains.
I'm trying to brainstorm some new entrances.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: The super hero landing is tried and true, but I feel it's a bit commonplace.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: I need a unique entrance that's still a good fit for me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Transform as you walk slowly.
If you don't like landing, then soar up into the air.
That's... so cool!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: So, the opposite of landing... interesting!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: But if I want to do that, I'd have to hide someplace below ahead of time.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: A hero never hides!
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace and I look at the top 10 entrances of the Ark Rangers.
Birdie.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: What do you think it means to be a hero?
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Spending your life warding off evil and bringing light everywhere you go.
Running towards what everyone else runs away from.
Haha. That's correct.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: But it's not so simple as just fending off evil.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: You need to hold onto something more valuable.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That's right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: That perfectly encapsulates what a hero should be. Someone who strives to protect others, even if it means putting themselves in danger.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: True heroes are willing to give up their lives in defense of those who cannot protect themselves.
adviseScripts.speaker: Laplace

adviseScripts.text: Laplace and I watch some classic superhero flicks.
